com.netspective.sparx.xif.dal
Class ConnectionContext

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.netspective.sparx.xif.dal.ConnectionContext
public class ConnectionContext
extends java.lang.Object

Database Object used by other DAL objects for accessing the database. To execute DAL operations within a transaction, use the beginTransaction() and commitTransaction() methods to mark the beginning and ending of the transaction.

It is important when using a transaction, the rollback method, rollbackTransaction(), is used when exceptions occur. For example: 

 try
 {
      ..
      ConnectionContext cc =  ConnectionContext.getConnectionContext(databaseContext, dataSourceId,
          ConnectionContext.CONNCTXTYPE_TRANSACTION);
      cc.beginTransaction();
      // do DAL operations here
      ...
      cc.commitTransaction();
 }
 catch (Exception e)
 {
      try
      {
          cc.rollbackTransaction();
      }
      catch (SQLException sqle)
      {
          // Failed to rollback. Do application specific handling
          ...
      }
 }

beginTransaction

public void beginTransaction()
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
Start a database transaction. If the ConnectionContext object was created without specifying the type to be CONNCTXTYPE_TRANSACTION, this method will modify the object into a transaction type and any database operation after this will become a part of a new transaction.

rollbackTransaction

public void rollbackTransaction()
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
Rolls back database operations executed within the transaction and closes the connection. No action is taken if the connection is not a transaction type.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException -  
Since:
Version 2.0.2 Build 0

commitTransaction

public void commitTransaction()
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
Commits database operations executed within the transaction and closes the connection. No action is taken if the connection is not a transaction type.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException -
